definition: Petrograd, variant spelling of 彼得堡[Bi3 de2 bao3], Saint Petersburg
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
square/frame/rule/(legal) case/style/character/standard/pattern/(grammar) case/(classical) to obstruct/to hinder/(classical) to arrive/to come/(classical) to investigate/to study exhaustively
to rein in/to compel/to force/to carve/to engrave/(literary) to command/to lead/bridle/(physics) abbr. for 勒克斯[le4 ke4 si1], lux

sentences.english: St. Petersburg had become Petrograd in 1914.
sentences.chinese: 聖彼得堡在1914年變成彼得格勒。

sentences.english: St. . Petersburg had become Petrograd in 1914.
sentences.chinese: 聖彼得堡在1914年變成彼得格勒。

definition: Leningrad, name of Russian city Saint Petersburg 聖彼得堡|圣彼得堡 1923-1991
Aleksandr Kolchak (1874-1920), Russian naval commander, head of anti-Bolshevik White forces
Leon Davidovich Trotsky (1879-1940), early Bolshevik leader, exiled by Stalin in 1929 and murdered in 1940

pinyin: Sai1 wa3 si1 tuo1 bo1 er3

definition: Vladimir Ilyich Lenin (1870-1924), Russian revolutionary leader
Yakov Mikhailovich Sverdlov (1885-1919), Bolshevik organizer, ordered the murder of the Tsar's family in 1918, died of Spanish influenza
pinyin: Si1 wei2 er3 de2 luo4 fu1
